account_id.description: ID of the Account originating the transfer. Filterable.

addenda.description: Additional payment-related information. Most uses will not require this field; contact support at help@treasuryprime.com to learn more. Currently only supported for ACH transfers with the SEC code `CCD` and `WEB`

amount.description: Amount of money to transfer, with two decimal precision

bank_id.description: ID of the bank with which the object is associated

bankdata.description: Optional arbitrary data that can be attached for the bank's use

batch_key.description: Batch configuration to use for payment

counterparty_id.description: ID of the Counterparty receiving the transfer. Be sure that the ach section of the Counterparty contains non-null values. Filterable.

direction.description: Direction of funds flow. One of `credit` (send money to your counterparty) or `debit` (receive money from your counterparty)

effective_date.description: The official effective date of the transaction, according to the ACH network. Filterable.

error.description: If the ACH has been returned, this will contain the ACH return reason code for this entry. For example, "R01" would indicate insufficient funds

org_id.description: ID of your organization. Filterable.

originator_name.description: Custom value for specifying the originating company name (maximum of 16 characters). This field will be blank unless explicitly set. This is only available to customers partnered with certain banks

scheduled_settlement.description: A timestamp dictating the approximate time a debit ACH hold will be released, and the debit ACH will be considered settled. (only available when originating ACH on Treasury Prime ledger accounts)

sec_code.description: One of ccd, ppd, or web. Specifies the transfer type, according to the ACH network

check_serial_number.description: ARC, BOC: Check serial number of the supporting document for the entry.

individual_id_number.description: CIE: The accounting number by which the payor (the consumer) is known to the payee (receiver/biller). (max 22 characters)

individual_name.description: CIE: Typically the name of the payor on whose behalf the entry was transmitted. (max 15 characters)

payment_type.description: WEB,TEL: One of `recurring`, `single`, or `subsequent`. An Originator of a debit entry must ensure that each consumer debit authorization includes language clearly stating whether the authorization obtained from the Receiver is for a single entry, recurring entries, or one or more subsequent entries initiated under the terms of a standing authorization

service.description: Either `standard` or `sameday`. Specifies same-day or standard processing.. Filterable.

userdata.description: Arbitrary data the user can attach to the object

value.error: ACH credit amount must not exceed the account's available balance.
You are not authorized to send ACH transfers in this direction. If you would like to request authorization, please contact support.
You have reached your ACH 24 hour velocity limit. This limit exists for your safety. If you would like to raise (or lower) your limit, please contact support.

data.message: Presidential pension for November 2021. Please deposit within 60 days.

account_id.description: ID of the Account issuing the check. Filterable.

amount.description: Amount of money to transfer, with two decimal precision

bank_id.description: ID of the bank with which the object is associated

check_date.description: Date on which the check was issued

check_number.description: The number printed on the issued check. Check numbers are automatically generated after check object creation

memo.description: Optional text to include on the memo line of the check (max of 40 characters)

message.description: Optional text to include on the bottom of the check page (maximum of 400 characters)

org_id.description: ID of the organization with which the object is associated. Filterable.

postal_code.description: Postal code (5-digit or 5+4 Zip Code for U.S. addresses)

state.description: State (max 2 characters)

street_line_1.description: First line of the address (max 35 characters)

street_line_2.description: Optional second line of the address (max 35 characters)

userdata.description: Arbitrary data the user can attach to the object

data.risk_rating_description: Risk rating assessment by RDC provider

account_id.description: ID of the Account receiving the deposit. Filterable.

amount.description: Amount of money to transfer, with two decimal precision. This must match the amount stated on the check

amount_discrepancy_detected.description: Flag indicating amount mismatch between `amount` and check image

back_image_file_id.description: ID of the .jpg file object representing an image of the back of the check. Currently we only accept JPG file format for images

decided_at.description: Timestamp of when the decision was made

decided_by.description: ID of the user who made the decision

device.description: Information on the device that captured the images

os_name.description: Name of the operating system the device is running. One of `android`, `blackberry`, `ios`, `windows`, or `unknown`

os_version.description: Major version number of the operating system the device is running (e.g. '12', '7', etc.), or the string `unknown`

error.description: Error message describing why a check was declined

front_image_file_id.description: ID of the .jpg file object representing an image of the back of the check. Currently we only accept JPG file format for images

ocr_account_number.description: Account number detected in check image

ocr_check_number.description: Check number detected in check image

ocr_routing_number.description: Routing number detected in check image

org_id.description: ID of the organization with which the object is associated. Filterable.

person_id.description: ID of the Person making the deposit. This ID must be in the array of person_ids of the account receiving the deposit

review_information.description: Additional context to support check reviews

risk_rating.description: Risk rating assessment by RDC provider

status.description: One of `pending`, `pending_review`, `submitted`, `sent`, `error`, `canceled_OCR`, or `returned`. Indicates the deposit's current status in the check workflow. Filterable.

userdata.description: Arbitrary data the user can attach to the object

ach.description: Account information for use with ACH transfers

routing_number.description: Valid 9-digit ABA routing transit number associated with the account. See the Routing Number endpoint for additional information.

name_on_account.description: Name of the account owner. Filterable.

plaid_processor_token.description: Plaid processor token, exchanged for an account number and routing number

userdata.description: Arbitrary data the user can attach to the object

wire.description: Account information for use with wire transfers

account_number.description: Bank account number for wire use (maximum of 34 characters)

address_on_account.description: Physical address associated with the account

postal_code.description: Postal code (5-digit or 5+4 Zip Code for U.S. addresses)

state.description: State (max 2 characters for US, max 3 characters for other countries)

street_line_1.description: First line of the address (max 35 characters)

street_line_2.description: Optional second line of the address (max 35 characters)

country.description: A 2 character ISO country code. Required for an international counterparty

postal_code.description: Postal code (5-digit or 5+4 Zip Code for U.S. addresses)

state.description: U.S. State (two letter abbreviation). If an international wire counterparty this is the Province or Region.

street_line_1.description: Street address (first line) (max 35 characters)

street_line_2.description: Street address (second line, if applicable) (max 35 characters)

routing_number.description: Valid 9-digit ABA routing transit number for the bank holding the account. See the Routing Number endpoint for additional information. For international wires this can be a valid BIC/SWIFT code

ach.description: Account information for use with ACH transfers

routing_number.description: Valid 9-digit ABA routing transit number associated with the account. See the Routing Number endpoint for additional information.

name_on_account.description: Name of the account owner. Filterable.

plaid_processor_token.description: Plaid processor token, exchanged for an account number and routing number

userdata.description: Arbitrary data the user can attach to the object

wire.description: Account information for use with wire transfers

account_number.description: Bank account number for wire use (maximum of 34 characters)

address_on_account.description: Physical address associated with the account

postal_code.description: Postal code (5-digit or 5+4 Zip Code for U.S. addresses)

state.description: State (max 2 characters for US, max 3 characters for other countries)

street_line_1.description: First line of the address (max 35 characters)

street_line_2.description: Optional second line of the address (max 35 characters)

country.description: A 2 character ISO country code. Required for an international counterparty

postal_code.description: Postal code (5-digit or 5+4 Zip Code for U.S. addresses)

state.description: U.S. State (two letter abbreviation). If an international wire counterparty this is the Province or Region.

street_line_1.description: Street address (first line) (max 35 characters)

street_line_2.description: Street address (second line, if applicable) (max 35 characters)

routing_number.description: Valid 9-digit ABA routing transit number for the bank holding the account. See the Routing Number endpoint for additional information. For international wires this can be a valid BIC/SWIFT code

ach.description: Account information for use with ACH transfers

routing_number.description: Valid 9-digit ABA routing transit number associated with the account. See the Routing Number endpoint for additional information.

name_on_account.description: Name of the account owner. Filterable.

account_id.description: ID of the Account to place the hold. Filterable.

account_id.description: ID of the Account receiving the transfer. Filterable.

account_type.description: The type of the receiving account, such as `checking` or `savings`

amount.description: Amount of money transferred, with two decimal precision

bank_id.description: ID of the bank with which the account is associated

company_desc.description: 10-character field that can be used by the originator to describe the payment

company_id.description: Code that the originating bank uses to identify the originator

company_name.description: Name of the company initiating the incoming ACH

description.description: Description that appears on the transaction record associated with the incoming ACH object

direction.description: Direction of funds flow. One of `credit` (money deposited into this account), or `debit` (money withdrawn from this account)

effective_date.description: The official effective date of the transaction, according to the ACH network

nacha_body.description: Data from the relevant NACHA file about the incoming ACH

name.description: The name of the receiver as obtained from the incoming ACH

org_id.description: ID of the organization with which the object is associated

original_transaction_id.description: ID of the transaction that the incoming ACH is directly related to. Filterable.

related_transaction_ids.description: List of all transaction IDs associated with the incoming ACH

sec_code.description: One of `arc`, `ccd`, `cie`, `cor`, `ctx`, `dne`, `iat`, `pos`, `ppd`, `tel`, or `web`. Specifies the transfer type, according to the ACH network

trace_number.description: Internal identifier used by the originating bank

transaction_code.description: Transaction code for this entry in the NACHA file

userdata.description: Arbitrary data the user can attach to the object

amount.description: Amount of money to transfer, with two decimal precision

balanced_at.description: Timestamp of when the balancing wire for the transfer was created/sent. Only present on `v2` transfers.

bankdata.description: Optional arbitrary data the bank can attach to the object

cross_bank.description: Identifies whether or not this transfer is between different banks. When true, Treasury Prime is explicitly directed to balance on-core funds between the two banks involved. Filterable.

error.description: Error message describing why a transfer failed

estimated_settlement_at.description: Timestamp of when the network transfer is estimated to complete. This will be the current timestamp in all cases except when the Network Transfer is outside of the bank's operating hours. In this situation, the timestamp will be the next banking business day

from_account_id.description: ID of the Account originating the transfer. Filterable.

org_id.description: ID of the organization with which this object is associated. Filterable.

to_account_id.description: ID of the Account receiving the transfer. Filterable.

userdata.description: Optional arbitrary data that can be attached for the bank's use

version.description: The API version used to create the network transfer

version.description: The API version used to create the network transfer

account_id.description: ID of the Account originating the transfer. Filterable.

amount.description: Amount of money to transfer, with two decimal precision

bankdata.description: Optional arbitrary data the bank can attach to the object

counterparty_id.description: ID of the Counterparty receiving the transfer. Be sure that the wire section of the Counterparty contains non-null values. Filterable.

error.description: Error message describing why a wire failed

imad.description: Optional Input Message Accountability Data. An ID often filled out by the banks, originating from fed processing

input_sequence_number.description: A 6 digit number assigned for uniqueness

input_source.description: 8 Alpha or Alpha-Numeric characters identifying the source

unparsed.description: Input Message Accountability Data: a unique number assigned to a wire transfer processed through the Federal Reserve Banks FedwireService

instructions.description: Optional instructions for the recipient (maximum of 140 characters)

intermediary.description: Optional intermediary bank information. If the recipient's bank is unable to receive a wire transfer, they will use an intermediary bank to process the wire

postal_code.description: Postal code (5-digit or 5+4 Zip Code for U.S. addresses)

state.description: State (max 2 characters for US, max 3 characters for other countries)

street_line_1.description: First line of the address (max 35 characters)

street_line_2.description: Optional second line of the address (max 35 characters)

name.description: Name of the bank (maximum of 35 characters)

routing_number.description: Valid 9-digit ABA routing transit number associated with the bank

omad.description: Optional Output Message Accountability Data. An ID originating from fed processing, similar structure to IMAD but with more info

frb_application_id.description: Uniquely identifies the Fedwire Funds Service site that processed the message (i.e., FT01, FT02 or FT03)

output_destination.description: 8 Alpha or Alpha-Numeric characters identifying the destination. Comparable to the IMAD `input_source`

output_sequence_number.description: A 6 digit number assigned for uniqueness. Comparable to IMAD `input_sequence_number`

unparsed.description: Output Message Accountability Data: a unique number assigned to a wire transfer processed through the Federal Reserve Banks FedwireService

org_id.description: ID of the organization with which this object is associated. Filterable.

purpose.description: Optional string identifying the reason for why these funds are being transferred. For example Payroll, Tuition, Travel, etc. Required if sending an international wire (maximum of 16 characters)

userdata.description: Optional arbitrary data the user can attach to the object

account_id.description: ID of the Account originating the transfer. Filterable.

amount.description: Amount of money to transfer, with two decimal precision

bankdata.description: Optional arbitrary data the bank can attach to the object

counterparty_id.description: ID of the Counterparty receiving the transfer. Be sure that the wire section of the Counterparty contains non-null values. Filterable.

instructions.description: Optional instructions for the recipient (maximum of 140 characters)

intermediary.description: Optional intermediary bank information. If the recipient's bank is unable to receive a wire transfer, they will use an intermediary bank to process the wire

state.description: State (max 2 characters for US, max 3 characters for other countries)

name.description: Name of the bank (maximum of 35 characters)

routing_number.description: Valid 9-digit ABA routing transit number associated with the bank

purpose.description: Optional string identifying the reason for why these funds are being transferred. For example Payroll, Tuition, Travel, etc. Required if sending an international wire (maximum of 16 characters)

counterparty_id.description: ID of the Counterparty receiving the transfer. Be sure that the wire section of the Counterparty contains non-null values. Filterable.

error.description: Error message describing why a wire failed

imad.description: Optional Input Message Accountability Data. An ID often filled out by the banks, originating from fed processing

input_sequence_number.description: A 6 digit number assigned for uniqueness

input_source.description: 8 Alpha or Alpha-Numeric characters identifying the source

unparsed.description: Input Message Accountability Data: a unique number assigned to a wire transfer processed through the Federal Reserve Banks FedwireService

instructions.description: Optional instructions for the recipient (maximum of 140 characters)

intermediary.description: Optional intermediary bank information. If the recipient's bank is unable to receive a wire transfer, they will use an intermediary bank to process the wire

postal_code.description: Postal code (5-digit or 5+4 Zip Code for U.S. addresses)

state.description: State (max 2 characters for US, max 3 characters for other countries)

street_line_1.description: First line of the address (max 35 characters)

street_line_2.description: Optional second line of the address (max 35 characters)

name.description: Name of the bank (maximum of 35 characters)

routing_number.description: Valid 9-digit ABA routing transit number associated with the bank

omad.description: Optional Output Message Accountability Data. An ID originating from fed processing, similar structure to IMAD but with more info

frb_application_id.description: Uniquely identifies the Fedwire Funds Service site that processed the message (i.e., FT01, FT02 or FT03)

output_destination.description: 8 Alpha or Alpha-Numeric characters identifying the destination. Comparable to the IMAD `input_source`

output_sequence_number.description: A 6 digit number assigned for uniqueness. Comparable to IMAD `input_sequence_number`

unparsed.description: Output Message Accountability Data: a unique number assigned to a wire transfer processed through the Federal Reserve Banks FedwireService

org_id.description: ID of the organization with which this object is associated. Filterable.

purpose.description: Optional string identifying the reason for why these funds are being transferred. For example Payroll, Tuition, Travel, etc. Required if sending an international wire (maximum of 16 characters)

userdata.description: Optional arbitrary data the user can attach to the object

status.description: New status for wire, one of: `canceled`

userdata.description: Arbitrary data the user can attach to the object

account_id.description: ID of the Account originating the transfer. Filterable.

amount.description: Amount of money to transfer, with two decimal precision

bankdata.description: Optional arbitrary data the bank can attach to the object

counterparty_id.description: ID of the Counterparty receiving the transfer. Be sure that the wire section of the Counterparty contains non-null values. Filterable.

error.description: Error message describing why a wire failed
